entry.def: Zhì Bó 智伯 (知伯), Earl of Zhì (died 453), notoriously ambitious and all-powerful Prime Minister Jìn 晉 under Jìn Āi gōng 晉哀公 Duke Āi of Jìn (reigned 456-438). The Earl was ruined in the end by his very ambitions. In 453 he was attacked and killed by a large alliance of forces consisting of his own allies, as he was attacking Xiāngzǐ 襄子 of Zhào 趙 at Jìnyáng 晉陽.

HF: Zhì Bó 智伯 ( 知伯 ), Earl of Zhì (died 453), notoriously ambitious and all-powerful Prime Minister Jìn 晉 during the early reign of Jìn Āi gōng 晉哀公 Duke Āi of Jìn (reigned 456-438). The Earl was ruined in the end by his very ambitions. In 453 he was attacked and killed by a large alliance of forces consisting of his own allies, as he was attacking Xiāngzǐ 襄子 at Jìnyáng 晉陽. One of his loyal servants was Yù Ràng 豫讓, immortalised by his extraordinary revenge for his master's assasination. (SJCD 280)
